_header: An angel bright / Came down with light / A message for to do
Subjects: Virgin Mary, Annunication to; carols, Annunciation
_description: James Ryman (?), A carol of the Annunciation — thirteen 6-line stanzas (aabaab) and 4-line burden (cdcd), or 4-line stanzas with leonine rhyme in odd-numbered lines (as it is written in MS); burden: ‘Thys ys fulle tru þis ys fulle tru / Who can sey Nay to thys / Mary ys modere of Ihesu / And god hys fadere ys’

CULEe112.First Lines:
An angelle bright came downe with lightA message for to
                    do…
CULEe112.Last Lines:
…And as he seyde that blessyd meydeThe modere of god
                    ys
CULEe112.Note: Not attributed to Ryman in the MS.

Zupitza,  Julius,
                        ed.

            1977: 180; 1977, 159-60.
